sentences: Arst kuulas patsiendi kopse ja südant.
context: The Estonian verb 'kuulama' has multiple meanings: 1) To listen to/hear something (music, radio, presentations), 2) To attend university lectures/classes, 3) To auscultate/examine medically (doctor examining patient's lungs and heart), 4) To ask about/inquire about information or job opportunities, 5) To follow/advice/obey commands or instructions. It can also be used as an interjection expressing surprise or emphasis similar to 'look' or 'see' in English.
